class kfs.core.offline_stores.file_store.FileOfflineStore[source]¶

Bases: kfs.core.offline_stores.offline_store.OfflineStore

static get_historical_features(config: kfs.repo_config.RepoConfig, feature_views: List[kfs.entities.feature_view.FeatureView], feature_refs: List[str], entity_df: Union[pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, str], registry: kfs.registry.Registry, project: str) → kfs.core.offline_stores.offline_store.RetrievalJob[source]¶
static pull_latest_from_table_or_query(config: kfs.repo_config.RepoConfig, data_source: Any, join_key_columns: List[str], feature_name_columns: List[str], event_timestamp_column: str, created_timestamp_column: Optional[str], start_date: datetime.datetime, end_date: datetime.datetime) → kfs.core.offline_stores.offline_store.RetrievalJob[source]¶

Note that join_key_columns, feature_name_columns, event_timestamp_column, and created_timestamp_column have all already been mapped to column names of the source table and those column names are the values passed into this function.

static write_offline_features(config: kfs.repo_config.RepoConfig, data: Optional[Union[pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, pyspark.sql.dataframe.DataFrame]], tables_to_keep: Sequence[Union[kfs.entities.feature_table.FeatureTable, kfs.entities.feature_view.FeatureView]], entities_to_keep: Sequence[kfs.entities.entity.Entity])[source]¶
Args:

config: RepoConfig data: dataframe or file_name or file_path Union[pd.DataFrame, pyspark.sql.DataFrame, str] entity_df: Union[pd.DataFrame, str] file_path: default or specify Optional[str] = config.offline_store_path or config.repo_path feature_view: feature, primary_key, feature_view_name List[FeatureView] registry: Registry format: delta, parquet(default), Hive, Hudi Optional[str] = ‘parquet’ project: str

kfs.core.offline_stores.offline_store module¶

class kfs.core.offline_stores.offline_store.OfflineStore[source]¶

Bases: abc.ABC

OfflineStore is an object used for all interaction between Feast and the service used for offline storage of features.

abstract static get_historical_features(config, feature_views: List[kfs.entities.feature_view.FeatureView], feature_refs: List[str], entity_df: Union[pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, str], registry: kfs.registry.Registry, project: str) → kfs.core.offline_stores.offline_store.RetrievalJob[source]¶
abstract static pull_latest_from_table_or_query(config, data_source: Any, join_key_columns: List[str], feature_name_columns: List[str], event_timestamp_column: str, created_timestamp_column: Optional[str], start_date: datetime.datetime, end_date: datetime.datetime) → kfs.core.offline_stores.offline_store.RetrievalJob[source]¶

Note that join_key_columns, feature_name_columns, event_timestamp_column, and created_timestamp_column have all already been mapped to column names of the source table and those column names are the values passed into this function.

abstract static write_offline_features(config: kfs.repo_config.RepoConfig, data: Optional[Union[pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, pyspark.sql.dataframe.DataFrame]], tables_to_keep: Sequence[Union[kfs.entities.feature_table.FeatureTable, kfs.entities.feature_view.FeatureView]], entities_to_keep: Sequence[kfs.entities.entity.Entity]) → None[source]¶
